metadata.title: Why Does It Take Time to Touch From Being Touched?

sections.content:
Question:
Why does it take some time for the detection of a touch (ON judgment) after touching the electrode?
Answer:
If the drift correction interval is short, the reference value will fluctuate before the finger touches the electrode, and sufficient fluctuation in the measured value for touch ON judgment may not be obtained.
In this case, it may be improved by adjusting the drift correction interval longer.
Or the number of consecutive match measurements set by the positive noise filter may be large.
ON is judged after ON is reached for the number of times set as the number of consecutive coincidence measurements.
Suitable Products
RX113
RX130
RX231, RX230
